Review Title: Good night sleep, great buffet, friendly staff ideal location to get into town with the train.
Negative Reviews: none
Positive Reviews:
We arrived after midnight after a long flight and they gave us an upgrade to a very luxerious suite. It's a pity we only could enjoy it for a good sleep but since you can use the room till 12.00 noon we enjoyed it a little longer.
The Breakfast buffet with lots of Asian and European style dishes was delicious and if you book it by checking in it's a cheaper rate.
After checking out you can still use their facilities like pool and showers and safely store your hand luggage till your departure.
Very good option for if you are in between transfer/stopover flights.

Negative Reviews:
Room 317, cleanliness in the bathroom behind the front sink stonecover., apparently never cleaned. While using the toilet at night, I took torch just to avoid switching the bathroom lights and waking up my husband.  Accidentally saw behind the sink frontal stone cover from the side, which is open, and it's awful dirty there. The glass cabin bathroom wall is fancy, but never dark in.this room, we ended up walking without lights on. 

The tv in our room had a chinese subtitle, which we were unable to turn off. Limited channels, complicated use, send error several times showing no internet connection.

The chaos of light switches in our room. Never found the right one.

Seating service for breakfast. As an adult couple, we weren't enjoying sitting next to a family of four with a bothering young girl ( around 10) who was very active for the whole time we spent our breakfast. Previously, we had luck couple of times and had beautifully calm brekkies, but not this time. There were a lot of empty tables around, so this should happen for some other reason.

Table cleaning service at breakfast. I had approached 5 times while my mouth was full with my breakfast. Once to try a new green brekky cocktail, one's to fill out a quick survey, 3 times to take an empty plate. While I understand they must keep the table clean, in my culture, we let ppl finish eating before approaching them. Maybe it's okay in Singapore.

Review Title: Totally smitten with this hotel in every way....will be back.
Negative Reviews: The only thing I can think of is adding a few more packets of coffee....2 is not enough :)
Positive Reviews:
We stayed in Premium Room #914 facing the Jewel rooms of the hotel and the Jewel.  Terminal 1 is a short walk.  
Check in was so efficient - in fact we arrived early from our cruise ending and expected to wait but we got so very lucky with a room being available.  
The Premium rooms have all you could ever want and I have to say that the set up in this room is totally guest friendly....pleasing colours, very clean and even though next to a runway, you could hardly hear any planes - most left early evening.  Lots of plants around the hotel, so pleasing.
Layout is such that you can both lay out a large suitcase without having one on the floor or bed to muddle through and leave it that way until you are ready to leave.  Large desk area, Coffee/tea, water supplied - plus you can always pick up more down in the gym.  Empty mini fridge.  Space to hang up clothes, dark curtains with sheers over, iron and board, a super wonderful bed to sleep in and the bathroom is wonderful.  Lots of counter space, bright, big shower stall and a bathtub.  Soft fluffy towels,  Excellent water pressure.
We had Breakfast  included and it was excellent....full buffet.
The pool...wonderful, like being in a tropical oasis when swimming or chilling with a drink.  At an airport?? who would ever know.  We did take taxis to Gardens by the Bay at around 20 SGD each way...very reasonable.  
They have recently spent millions on enhancements and it shows....someone has put a lot of thought into what hotel guests would like.  Busy busy but each person is special.  Front counter staff so friendly and throughout the hotel all you meet are exactly the same.  
The perfect spot to be to visit the Jewel as well...what an amazing place - filled with tons of places to eat, to shop and of course watch the waterfall...especially in the evenings when a light show takes place....totally smitten.

We loved this beautiful hotel. The rooms are so well designed and comfortable. The layout of all the trees surrounding the walkways was lovely. Check-in was carried out online the day before our visit. When our flight was delayed by 6 hours, I was worried we would lose the room as our arrival would be significantly later than we had agreed. I emailed the hotel explaining the problem and they not only accepted a revised arrival time, but also gave us a later check out so we could sleep in a bit. We were so grateful for that. 
Finding the hotel from the airport was super easy and we had a lovely stay.

Review Title: Totally smitten with this hotel in every way....will be back.
Negative Reviews: The only thing I can think of is adding a few more packets of coffee....2 is not enough :)
Positive Reviews:
We stayed in Premium Room #914 facing the Jewel rooms of the hotel and the Jewel.  Terminal 1 is a short walk.  
Check in was so efficient - in fact we arrived early from our cruise ending and expected to wait but we got so very lucky with a room being available.  
The Premium rooms have all you could ever want and I have to say that the set up in this room is totally guest friendly....pleasing colours, very clean and even though next to a runway, you could hardly hear any planes - most left early evening.  Lots of plants around the hotel, so pleasing.
Layout is such that you can both lay out a large suitcase without having one on the floor or bed to muddle through and leave it that way until you are ready to leave.  Large desk area, Coffee/tea, water supplied - plus you can always pick up more down in the gym.  Empty mini fridge.  Space to hang up clothes, dark curtains with sheers over, iron and board, a super wonderful bed to sleep in and the bathroom is wonderful.  Lots of counter space, bright, big shower stall and a bathtub.  Soft fluffy towels,  Excellent water pressure.
We had Breakfast  included and it was excellent....full buffet.
The pool...wonderful, like being in a tropical oasis when swimming or chilling with a drink.  At an airport?? who would ever know.  We did take taxis to Gardens by the Bay at around 20 SGD each way...very reasonable.  
They have recently spent millions on enhancements and it shows....someone has put a lot of thought into what hotel guests would like.  Busy busy but each person is special.  Front counter staff so friendly and throughout the hotel all you meet are exactly the same.  
The perfect spot to be to visit the Jewel as well...what an amazing place - filled with tons of places to eat, to shop and of course watch the waterfall...especially in the evenings when a light show takes place....totally smitten.

Negative Reviews: They send you email for pre-check but then you still need to wait in line for check-in because the system in self-checkin does not work.
Positive Reviews: They gave us free upgrade and we felt like king and queen! Location is perfect, you can walk to Jewell and sky train stops right next to the hotel. We would definitely stay again!

Positive Reviews:
We loved this beautiful hotel. The rooms are so well designed and comfortable. The layout of all the trees surrounding the walkways was lovely. Check-in was carried out online the day before our visit. When our flight was delayed by 6 hours, I was worried we would lose the room as our arrival would be significantly later than we had agreed. I emailed the hotel explaining the problem and they not only accepted a revised arrival time, but also gave us a later check out so we could sleep in a bit. We were so grateful for that. 
Finding the hotel from the airport was super easy and we had a lovely stay.

Review Title: Ideal for tired travellers with easy city transfer to enjoy all that Singapore has to offer
Negative Reviews:
Renovations did mean that breakfast was served in a room that had no character and no windows. 
We will definitely go back after the renovations to see what changes have been made.
Positive Reviews:
After a long flight, the ability to walk straight into the hotel was priceless. Flying into Terminal 3 was an easy walk, flying into terminal 2 was a simple sky train transfer. 
Access to the city was via MRT which was just below the hotel, and access to the Jewel shopping mall and Waterfall Canopy Park was a 5 minute walk away.
Despite being under renovation and some disruption to service, the hotel staff were amazing - Prior to arrival we were notified of a room change and were kept up to date with renovation progess. Our original room booking was no longer available but we were upgraded and we were able to access the club lounge benefits, including evening canapes and drinks. 
The pool area was lovely and there was always bottled water available. 
We would definitely stay again.

Negative Reviews:
I arrived early to Singapore and went to the hotel to try and see if I can get a room for a few hours. One of the lady’s that was at reception was very very rude and did not want to help me at all !!! First thing she said to me when I asked if I could book a room was sorry I can’t help you or book a room for you and you must book the room online and once that’s complete I can check you in at 9am or 10am . I said that’s not a problem at all I can do that, once I did that and showed her that I booked it she said “that’s great you booked it” I can’t check you in before 12pm. I understand there is hotel rules and policy’s but this lady’s focus is not customer service at alll !!!!!! She must go she was rude and arrogant and if she doesn’t like her job go find another one.

There was a lovely man that came and helped me when I came back around 11am he was wearing glasses he got me my room ready within half an hour and got me into the free breakfast buffet !! Put me on the highest floor so I can rest and get some sleep as I had been travelling without sleep ! This is what you call customer service !!
Positive Reviews: It’s great for a layover !!!!! The breakfast was great ! The poool was great ! The room was amazing !!! The shower and the bed perfect would stay here again for sure when I come

Positive Reviews: Excellent location to access Jewel and Changi airport. We had Jewel Wing room with view of runway. Great bathtub. Staff were really kind and accommodating. Don’t know all their names but Salam was very helpful with pushing wheelchair of my elderly mother. The front desk person (sorry didn’t take his name) was very attentive and helpful in arranging help with our luggage. Aloysius helped us with our luggage to the airport. Really appreciated this with our big group with young kids and elderly parents.

Negative Reviews:
We called from the room in the evening to ask if there was any parking voucher/coupon available. Staff just said no as carpark belongs to the airport. 

When we went to checkout, we were lucky there was another guest asking about carpark too. We overheard there was discounted parking voucher guests could buy for 36h ($27). 

We were just glad we overheard and did not choose to do express check out. 

We wished the hotel would volunteer this information right from the beginning during check in.
Positive Reviews:
The breakfast spread was great. 

Room size was very large. There was even a sofa in it. The soundproofing was excellent. We didn't hear any airplane sounds. It could be because we weren't in the direct flight path. The bathroom was very huge too.

The pool was lovely. It didn't feel like we were in Singapore. 

We spent the night at the hotel after our wedding. Hotel was nice to decorate the room with petals and gave us a cake for celebration. We really appreciate it.

Review Title: Comfortable and friendly hotel right in Changi Airport, great for a break between long flights.
Negative Reviews: We couldn't get the room temperature above 20 deg C no matter how high we set the thermostat, and ended up turning the AC off in the bedroom.
Positive Reviews:
After collecting our bags at Changi Terminal 3 it was just a 5 minute walk to the hotel, all inside and well signed. Check-in was quick and friendly. We had booked a room with a king-size bed, but were upgraded to a suite at no extra cost, which was large and very comfortable. After a long flight from Auckland we were ready for a swim, and the pool was lovely. Then we went for a walk to the Jewel shopping centre, about 10 minutes walk from the hotel, all inside. This has a spectacular waterfall from the ceiling, lots of restaurants and shops. 
Back in the hotel we had a good night's sleep, another swim in the morning and an excellent breakfast from the extensive buffet, before walking back to check in for our flight to London. 
The hotel is not cheap, but well worth the money for a refreshing break between long flights.

Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: The Crowne Plaza was conveniently located inside the airport which made it an easy transition after a long flight. Our room had a view of the ‘Jewel’ which was only a quick walk away, via a connected walkway.  Our room was spacious and the bed was super comfy. There was a large soaking bathtub which was perfect after a long day. We would definitely stay again for a longer period of time, though this was just a stop over visit.

Review Title: great for kids who love aeroplanes!
Negative Reviews: some “caution wet floors” signs were not placed accurately near the puddles of water. my little one slipped and fell once.
Positive Reviews:
We had the room with the runway view and it was superb. My little one absolutely enjoyed it! The sound proofing was ok, you can still hear the planes taking off and landing, but it was not a nuisance at all. The sounds sound muted, so that was good. 
breakfast was okay, not fantastic and lavish, but better than average. Sad thing was hash browns were not there the day we had the breakfast and my little one was very sad, cos hash browns were his favourite. 
staff was very helpful - helped with my luggage the min I alighted from the taxi. staff was also very attentive and attended to me to see what they could help when I was waiting in the Q at the reception twice. 
Hotel also gave a small complimentary cake for my little one’s bday. However, the person who called me and asked if I would be in to receive the cake took a long time to come. I think I waited for about an hour or two. He said he was
coming over when we were on the phone, but it took quite some time. 
loved the location and the view of the aeroplanes and wished it was not so pricey. haha. other than that, all is good!

Review Title: Amazing stay if you have to spend a night at the airport
Negative Reviews: none
Positive Reviews:
The staff were super nice- we got a free upgrade once they heard our story about missing our flight and having to spend the night at the hotel, this was super nice of them.
The room was great and super clean, central AC so nothing blows in your head, super comfortable bed, lots of hot water, nice towels and bathrobes.
Breakfast was excellent- foe 15 eur/ pp you get a huge variety of delicious Asian and also Western options. Eggs are made on the spot including Eggs Benedict. Also Asian noodles are made on the spot with add-ons. Super delicious.
They have great location at T3, super close to the gates and also a wonderful swimming pool. Perfect to relax.
Also, there is a bar open until late jn the evening (23:00-00:00) with decent cocktails and even some food options

Review Title: Comfy, unique and a real bucket list item.
Negative Reviews:

Positive Reviews:
We were there for a 23 hour stop over and were fortunate enough to check in 90 mins early with no extra charge. 

Rachel at reception welcomed us like celebrities. She gave us great suggestions for special events and shows at The Jewel to see during our stay.

Best hotel bed I've ever had. Plush and comfortable. 

Extensive room service menu for all tastebuds. A bit pricey but was all delicious and exceeded expectations.

Laying and watching planes taking off and landing from bed was something so niche and my husband loved it. Can cross that off the bucket list.

Express checkout was a breeze, bonus of being able to pay via eftpos when room service was brought up, which cut out that time having to settle a bill when leaving.

Shower had a beautiful rainfall shower head with great pressure and got super hot. Beautiful complimentary toiletries were a bonus.

Review Title: Ideal to break a long flight en route to Europe & to de-stress late arrivals and early departures.
Negative Reviews:
We used this hotel as a "bookend" to a week's stay in Singapore.  On arrival it was great to be able to walk off the plane into a very nice hotel room with bath and King-Sized bed, rather than to have a take a cab into the city and take up another hour or more to check into a city hotel.  With a 12-noon checkout, this could comfortably be left until the following day.
At the end of our week in Singapore we had an early flight home.  Again, we chose to overnight at Crowne Plaza, taking the rush out of checking out of a city hotel to get to the airport by 7:30am to check into our flight.  We spent a pleasant and relaxed late afternoon and overnight at Crowne Plaza Changi and simply walked from the hotel to the departure gate after an early breakfast.
One puzzling aspect was that on arrival on the inward and outward stays the hotel reception staff went to some lengths to point out that as we have booked through Booking.com we weren't actually entitled to the benefits usually offered to IHG Members such as an upgrade to the higher room category.  Thankfully, on both occasions, after pointing out that it would be better if we booked directly, the check-in staff did actually upgrade us to a superior room category. 🤔
Positive Reviews:
Room was generous in size and appointment.  Breakfast was an extensive buffet and good value.

Review Title: Totally worth the cost & amazing location
Positive Reviews:
It was amazing to get off a 17 hr flight and only have a short walk to the hotel. We only had a 24 hr layover in Singapore so this allowed us to maximize our time to rest up & sightsee. 

The room was gorgeous with a free standing soaking tub, separate waterfall shower with amazing smelling soaps & lotions. It was only a 5 min walk to the Jewel which turned out to just be a shopping call with all the same shops as back home in the states + tons of restaurants. The waterfall feature in the atrium was under its annual maintenance and off so not nearly as cool as the photos online. 

The train to get to the city is right next to the hotel as well and super easy and clean. 

We got back from sightseeing and had some extra time before our flight and we’re allowed to use the pool which was beautiful & there was showers so we could be clean and ready for our next flight. it was pricey ti stay here but 100% worth it.

The location works brilliantly for us.  We simply catch the T1 to T3 train at SGP airport, and then walk a few steps to the airport link.  There-after, we use the MRT to travel into the city, or to visit attractions.  Leaving SGP for our next stop is simply a reverse of the above steps, and we can get a shower and change before leaving.

We also like the room with its 'borrowed light' arrangement for the bathroom (a glass wall with blind for privacy) - it feels bright and airy.

Review Title: Our objective for a good rest was not realised due to faulty air conditioning problem.
Negative Reviews: My daughter who has stayed with you when on business in Singapore strongly recommended that we have a break on our way home from London. After the long flight from London my wife and I booked the room so that we could get a good rest before continuing on to Sydney the next evening.  We had some dinner before we went to bed a couple of hours after our flight arrival but the room was freezing and the air conditioning temperature could not be adjusted.  After wrestling with the problem for some time I finally realised that there must be something wrong with the controller. I rang reception who sent up a maintenance person to investigate.  He was very courteous and after inspecting something in the ceiling found that it could not be rectified quickly and arranged with reception for us to move to another room.  This was done but it meant that we had to re pack our belongings throw on a gown and move all and sundry a few rooms down the hallway.  The staff again were very helpful but by the time we got settled, several hours of our room booking had passed before we were able to try to get some rest, which was the main objective of our stay so your question about value for money can only be answered by saying that our own experience with our crown stay was not the same good value that my daughter experiences.
Positive Reviews: Room was well presented and very clean.  The staff were very attentive and professional. The breakfast offerings are excellent and would suit all tastes.

Review Title: Great and very convenient stay at the Crowne
Negative Reviews: Even though the room was almost perfect - clean, spacious and comfy, there was one thing that was annoying. Our room's toilet had some extra sewage holes apart from the one in the shower - we assumed this was to make cleaning easier.  However, the one nearby the toilet was expelling some nasty sewage smell. While it was not a powerful smell and didn't leave the toilet, it was enough  for us not to fully enjoy our experience at the Crowne. We (sort of) solved this by moving the toilet bin on top of it, but still...
Positive Reviews: My stay was truly great. My partner and I booked Crowne Plaza at Changi because we had a layover of 15ish hours. Not enough time to go to city centre, and too long to stay around the airport (regardless of how great Changi is!). We decided to go to Crowne Plaza at the airport. Aligned to how well designed the airport is, this Crowne exceeded expectations. The lobby is modern, the staff was very accommodating and friendly and the room was clean and spacious. Apart from the convenience of the hotel's location (which is perfect for long layovers), what I liked the most was the way this hotel was designed: Rooms are not connected through aircon closed-corridors, but instead through a nice open space that connects to the pool - like how you would get from some beach resorts - topping it up with an outside view from the Jewel.

Review Title: Disappointing, over-priced stay in a non-accessible room
Negative Reviews: I booked an accessible room well in advance, but was told upon arrival that they had given all of them away. None of the staff I spoke with seemed to understand that by giving us a non-accessible room they were essentially giving us a bed, but no bathroom. The front desk repeatedly told us that a non-accessible room would be fine because "it is big and close to the elevator" (not understanding the other features of an accessible room). We were also assured that if our assigned room wasn't suitable, we could call down and they would find a solution. However, once I saw the room (which was definitely not accessible) and called the help desk, they reiterated that there was no other room since they gave the room we booked away. In the end, we had a very difficult stay, made only slightly better by the assurance of a shower chair to our door. However, in the end, they only brought up a cheap plastic stool - not a shower chair that provides balance and support. Just to clear: before leaving a negative review, I tried resolving this in two other ways: (1) I asked for a refund BEFORE accepting the keys (so I could find an alternative hotel) but was told it wasn't possible since the booking was through Booking.com and (2) contacted the company directly several days ago, but have yet to hear back.
Price from time of reservation to payment changed upwards

I was told my booking was only for 2 breakfast and most pay for the 3rd, I advised staff I have already paid for 3pax for breakfast show staff booking confirmation they still insist I must pay for additional breakfast. When I approached reception, (due to leaving early next morning) it felt like they were brushing me off especially when I was wanting to pay/query any outstanding charges as we were leaving early around 05:30 I was been told not to worry as I have paid deposit and any outstanding amount would be taken from deposit and any amount left over will be deposited back into my account. Yet they have my card details and would basically take out any amount - I was also told there is nothing to pay, and the whole amount of my deposit has been refunded back into my account. this was not the case I got a big, massive bill and still waiting for a Tax Invoice/Receipt I have been RIPPED OFF. Review Title: Not a " Home away from Home" despite the  very positive responses when asked for support.
Negative Reviews:
When asking questions via booking.com when making the booking the resultant response was very poor as if a low quality AI based system was responding to our queries which they interpreted incorrectly and the response time in some instances was up to 3 days .  When the responses arrived they were not in plan english but obviously used local colloquial language An example in response to a cost query was $140++ .  I had no idea what this meant and till today can only guess what it meant.
Whilst there were many positives of our stay the room we were assigned to was tired, needed some maintenance and extra attention to mould on tiling interfaces which is always a problem from our experience living in high humidity conditions such as Singapore.
In room advice on how to find things around Crowne plaza were poor.
Overall, Crowne does not fit into a Home Away from Home despite the many good adjacent facilities that we found and it is a pity because the staff are fantastic.  The answer to the question " would I return or use another IHG facility, is that I  doubt it unless the above issues are addresed.

Review Title: Decline in customer service. Disappointing experience
Negative Reviews:
We recently revisited the Crown at Changi Airport, a place we'd enjoyed on multiple occasions in the past. Unfortunately, this stay fell short of our expectations, primarily due to ongoing renovations that significantly impacted our overall experience.

One major letdown was the breakfast, once a highlight of our visits. The temporary setup in a function space lacked the charm of the usual dining area, and the food selection had dwindled to a mere 10% of its former glory. It was a far cry from the delightful mornings we remembered.

However, the most frustrating aspect of our stay revolved around the bed arrangement. Despite booking a room for two adults and a child, we were initially provided with a baby cot that was impractical for our almost 4-year-old. Upon requesting a proper bed, we were met with resistance and told it was a last-minute request, with an additional charge of $60 for an extra bed. After persistent communication, a bed was begrudgingly provided, leaving us disheartened by the service quality.

It's disconcerting to witness such a decline in service standards over the past year. We can no longer wholeheartedly recommend the Crown at Changi Airport, as our recent experience has left us questioning the value and hospitality that were once synonymous with this establishment.
Small and dingy not worth the price. Given wrong bed configuration.

Negative Reviews:
The hotel was being refurbished, I was warned about this prior to my arrival, originally I had booked a Junior suite with pool access but the hotel sent me a message before our trip explaining that they would upgrade me to suite should the work still be continuing in December, so I stupidly kept booking..

Upon arrival I was given a room near the top floor, there was no mention of my room being unavailable, which I felt was poor so I had to then ask the reception staff what room it actually was that we would be staying in, I was told I had been given an upgrade to a suite due to the refurbishment.

Room 819 - discusting old and tatty, it was basically just a Junior suite but with no pool access so I was basically paying for a downgraded room to what I originally booked.
I was appalled at how disgracefully decorated the room was and how tatty simple things were like the curtains, furniture, decor etc.
I rang downstairs to reception straight away to tell them that the room was not up to standard and surely was not a suite as it just looked like a horrible version of the room I originally booked but without pool access. I was then informed by another member of staff who actually brought up in conversation that we were in the same type of room as we originally booked as I think she was confused..So not only had I been lied to by the first member of staff but also by the admin team who messaged me prior to our arrival.
I literally said to the staff that this can't be an upgrade as it was a disgusting room on the 8th floor dark dingy and in need of TLC.
I was as honest and truthful about my feelings on the matter of the room being so poor that I just asked the staff "please do you have any nicer rooms at all" it was as simple as that after taking time away to try and sort a different room out we were left waiting for ages only to be told they have no rooms available.

Negative Reviews:
Check in staff clueless. I asked for a runway view when booking and was told it was an extra charge. Fair enough. Upon arrival I was told it had been issued complimentary… I double checked, yes I was told definitely a free upgrade. You’ve guessed it,, upon check out different staff told me I hadn’t paid for the upgrade. I argued the point to no avail. 

Also at check in, at 0100 hrs I asked f the supermarket under the hotel was open. Same girl said yes 24/7. So after dropping bags off I went only to find everything shut. That really should have been my clue that this staff member didn’t have a clue.

All in all still a good hotel, but this leaves a bad taste in the mouth… and it really is time the rooms were updated, that awful green carpet has been in the rooms for at least 15 years now.

Inflexible checkin for an airport hotel. Having already paid S$420 for a standard room without breakfast, we were asked for another S$180++ to check in early. The room was vacant and ready. We sat around the pool area until 1.00pm after a 12 hour flight. I wasn’t prepared to pay S$600 for a 24 hr stay. We were checking out at 7.00am the following morning as they were aware. 
We stop over here frequently. In the past, they haven’t been so focussed on revenue from early arrivals. 

Renovations- extensive- which I was only made aware of 48hrs before arrival. Loose dangerous boards around the pool area. Construction workers in the hotel. No bar area. Dining area with no natural light. We went back to the Airport terminal for dinner. No atmosphere or comfort outside of your room.

We booked one of their supposedly best rooms, a king with pool view for $400 including taxes for 1 night. The bathroom was falling apart. The door handles were broken and it made an unpleasant creaking sound. The room was too cold (20c) and the thermostat didn't work when we set it to a comfortable temperature. The room had some type of allergens like dust or mold, which made all of us sick by the end of our 12 hour transit time. It didn't meet our expectations as a 4 star hotel. The room looked and felt more like a 2 or 3 star.
You have to go through immigration in order to enter the hotel. We were ready for it just in case with the Singapore white card, but I feel that's unnecessary trouble and not something I expected when I booked a transit hotel inside the airport.

We were able to access a 24 hour food court with supermarket to buy our son milk and taxis where easily accessible if you wished to go into the city ( which we did!). 

Staff were friendly and helpful for the short time we were there. We also had help with our luggage to and from the room.

Review Title: Badly designed rooms for sleep and poorly managed hotel - Avoid
Negative Reviews: When we arrived we were given room 512. My understanding is most rooms of the standard we had booked were similar in that the bathroom/toilet is basically a glass box so you can full view from the adjacent bed and tv area. But who in there right mind wants to watch your partner on the toilet?  At 11pm we retire to bed however we are receiving bright lights from the two outside windows on the bathroom external wall, which opens out into the open landing outside our room! We could not sleep. So I point this out to reception and they give us another room on the 8th floor, which was identical, i.e. the same problem! I go back down to reception and their response was some guests like the room set up. I had shown the problem to the staff member who accompanied us to room 512, who was unable to come up with a solution. I described the issue to 2 different reception staff who were unable to come up with a solution. I spent the rest of the night and morning in the lounge area awake. I asked for a cup of coffee as the 4* hotel offered 24 hour service, but I was declined. The reception staff said we could bring you coffee to your room but not to the lounge area. I said I didn't want to disturb my wife by ordering room service, and anyway the coffee machine was in the restaurant next to the lounge area! Sorry she replied you can only order from your room!!
Positive Reviews: Nothing! The hotel is badly managed by inexperienced staff. The cost of £275 a night is unrealistic as the hotel offers poor value of a 2* hotel standards rather than the 4* advertised. My experience and advice is avoid at all costs. Search one of the hotels within the airport complex and use the lovely shopping/restaurant area called 'Jewels'!
It's connected right at the airport.

Negative Reviews: The body lotion was not filled up & only one soap. Door access did not work, but we were well looked after once we went back & forth a couple of times & we were moved to another upgraded  room. We also appreciated free drinks at the lounge bar whilst everything got sorted.

Negative Reviews: wasn’t clean. beds were uncomfortable.
Positive Reviews: close to the airport

Negative Reviews:
Honestly loved my stay, but there was one big issue for us: there was a lot of wear/tear in the room and the cleanliness of the room was not up to my expectations, with the room rate in mind and considering this is Singapore.

Eg; a lot of dents in the wooden furniture,  lines between the tiling seemed to contain dirt/mould in the bathroom. Stains on the ceiling. The carpet was not thoroughly cleaned: crumbs, hair and other debris clearly visible. Dust on visible parts of eg the television, dirt/spots under cubboards. What icked me out the most was that the glass separating the room from the bathroom was filthy; you could see grease from hands and other things on the glass, a lot of scratches, etc.

We should have immediately mentioned it to the staff, but we came off a long haul and went to sleep. Felt wrong to complain only 8hrs later.

Truly loved this hotel, but the cleanliness was not up to par.
Positive Reviews:
-Runway view room is an AVgeeks dream. 24/7 spotting opportunities. Nothing beats waking up in front of some A380s, A350s and 777s. Defenitly worth the upcharge!
-Location is amazing. Walking distance from most of Changi airport. The Jewel only a min or 3 on foot away from the hotels entrance.
-Staff super friendly and accomodating. Granted an early check-in (with a reasonable fee).
-Gym is definetly above average for a hotel gym. Managed to squeeze in a few real decent workouts.
-Nice, big enough, clean pool. Bonus point for the very soft complementary towels.
-Rooms are big enough, nicely designed

the room is big but the toilet is not properly clean, the mirror is with water mark …

Negative Reviews: After an initial delay in having our room allocated to us.  We were up-graded to a runway view room, which was nice on behalf of the hotel.  On arrival to our room however, the door handle to the bathroom was broken and the roller blind to the bathroom fell down from its wall mount.  The room looks tired and warm, I noticed that the bed head was extremely stained (Im glad i didnt have a blue light..).  We informed reception, and we were then moved to another room, which was in much better condition.
Positive Reviews: We booked the hotel due to location and proximity to the Jewel and terminal 3 at changi airport.  This all lived up to expectation, and is the perfect location to base prior to takeoff.

Negative Reviews: Mistakes were made when we checked in, rooms were not cleaned (although this had been requested), rooms had no windows so there was no ventilation. the second building where the rooms were located is far from the main building, which is likely why it took a very long time for simple items such as water bottles or additional towels to reach the room. Room service was also cold by the time it reached the room.
Positive Reviews: Excellent location, and lovely concierge staff.

Negative Reviews: A long walk to my room. The hotel is length wise rather than level wise.

Review Title: Nice bed, but not for the room cleanliness
Negative Reviews: My first experience with a 5-star hotel that I need to request for room cleaning. If you did not request for cleaning then there will be no cleaning done in your room regardless how many days you are staying in the hotel. There wasn’t even a signage or note indicated that I need to request for room cleaning. This is so disappointing to know if from a 5-star hotel, thot they stated cleanliness and comfort is the best from the hotel. What a disappointment, the breakfast was not as fantastic as well, repeatable breakfast throughout my stay. I was expecting something nice based on the price, but nothing special except mini prata, sausages, scrambled eggs, breads and some dim sum.
Positive Reviews: I like the customer service at the counter, the lady whom served me is great. Welcome me with a smile and check with me if I need an room upgrade since the room I booked may not be able to fit in an additional bed for my kid. So I did my room upgrade. The room was spacious and nice, bed was so comfy that I can instantly fell asleep the moment I lay on the bed. It’s a nice room.

The water didn't come out in the right direction, so it was useless. The flush was weak, so it always took a few flushes to get the toilet paper down.

Review Title: Convenient but pricey swim and sleepover.
Negative Reviews:
I paid quite a lot for a short night in this hotel. The swimming pool and the bedroom facilities were good, but I was taken aback to realise the room rate didn't include breakfast, for which I had to pay separately.
It made a good stop over between long haul flights and it was convenient; I felt that the price reflected the fact they have a "captive clientele" of travellers!
Positive Reviews:
I chose this hotel because I had long enough between flights to need a bath and bed, but not time to explore Singapore. It's located at the end of Terminal 3, so within the (Changi) Airport itself.
I was pleased to arrive in time to use the swimming pool, which was lovely. The reception staff were helpful, but I felt rather lonely when I reached my room, which was at the furthest end of the building from reception. My room was well appointed with a good view from the smart bathroom, which had a large bath. I had everything I needed and the bed was comfortable.

I didn't like about when my Wife's injury require a certain amount of ice. And we had to request for it so many times. Like we requested for 1 ice bucket but only 1 small plastic cup came. 

Requesting wasn't the problem but the amount that came was problem as it wasn't the amount we requested for and we had to make multiple request throughout the day just to get the right amount to cool her wound down. 

Overall the staffs are very friendly and helpful. I just hate the hassle of always calling to request and when the ice came, it was always in small plastic cups that is barely sufficient to cool her ice packs for her injury. I was not very pleased about it. But I am overall grateful for the help.
